item.description: List of common firewall linux 1. item.title: Run Script in background on system startup with nohup
item.description: Install nohup which is used to run processes in background sudo apt install nohup Create a simple shell script in /usr/local/bin which is gonna be responsible for starting the script via nohup. #! /bin/sh nohup php8.0 /path/to/myscript.php >/dev/null 2>&1 & Make it executable: sudo chmod u+x myscript.sh Symlink script to /etc/init.d/ sudo ln -s /usr/local/bin/myscript.sh /etc/init.d/ Symlink the symlink to /etc/rc2.d. Prepend the scriptname with S[NUMBER]. Number is used by the system to determine the order of executing the scripts in the /etc/rc2.
